title: Texans' Stroud suffers concussion after hard hit
content: Texans quarterback C.J. Stroud has been ruled out of Sunday's game against the Broncos after suffering a concussion following a big hit in the second quarter.

title: Auburn fires Freeze following 6-16 mark in SEC
content: Auburn has fired football coach Hugh Freeze, who had a 15-19 record and a 6-16 mark in SEC games in his two-plus seasons. D.J. Durkin will be the interim coach.

title: Texas Tech, Irish in top 10 before 1st CFP ranking
content: The top seven teams were unchanged in the final AP poll before the College Football Playoff releases its first ranking Tuesday, with BYU, Texas Tech and Notre Dame filling out the top 10.

title: Sources: Nebraska QB Raiola has broken fibula
content: Nebraska quarterback Dylan Raiola suffered a broken right fibula against USC, sources told ESPN, and the sophomore will sit out the remainder of the season.

title: Lady Vols' Whitehorn dismissed after 2nd arrest
content: Tennessee women's basketball coach Kim Caldwell dismissed senior guard Ruby Whitehorn from the team after she was arrested and charged for a second time in less than two months.

title: 76ers star Embiid fined $50K for lewd gesture
content: The NBA has fined Philadelphia center Joel Embiid $50,000 for making what the league determined to be a lewd gesture in Friday's game.

title: Gamecocks, SEC worst on offense, fire OC Shula
content: South Carolina has fired offensive coordinator Mike Shula just nine games into his first season in the role. The Gamecocks rank last in the SEC in points and yards per game.

title: T-minus two days until NFL trade deadline: Graziano has the latest intel you need to know
content: Could the Pats add an RB? Will the Dolphins unload players? Is Kirk Cousins staying put? Here's the latest on Tuesday's trade deadline from around the NFL.

title: Our trade grades: Did the Eagles fix their CB situation with Alexander, Carter?
content: Grading deals leading into the trade deadline, including Philly adding Michael Carter II and Jaire Alexander.

title: Hugh Freeze out at Auburn: Top candidates, transfers and recruits
content: After less than three seasons, they need a new coach on the Plains. Here's what could come next at Auburn.

title: Inside the night the Dodgers became back-to-back World Series champs -- and Yamamoto became an L.A. legend
content: After seven games, plenty of extra innings, and a history-making pitching turn, the first repeat champions of this century could finally exhale.

title: Week 9 inactives: Status for Kupp, Kamara and others
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: Overheard in college football Week 10: Steve Sarkisian, Ryan Day headline top quotes
content: Sarkisian took a positive outlook on Texas' shaky fourth quarter during its win over Vanderbilt, among other quips.

title: If Man City are going to win the Premier League, all roads lead to Haaland
content: Every team needs a striker to be in top form, and if Manchester City are going to win the Premier League, they will need to get the best out of Erling Haaland.

title: Way-too-early 2026 MLB Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers or Blue Jays No. 1?
content: Los Angeles just won the 2025 World Series -- and we're already looking ahead to next year. Where does your favorite team fall?

title: 17 men's college basketball teams that could win 30 games in 2025-26
content: History says a 30-win season could lead to a national title (see: Florida). Which teams could achieve the feat this season?

title: Brian Schottenheimer's role in Matt Eberflus' defense; Kyler Murray back home in Texas
content: Cowboys' HC is helping the struggling D, while the Cardinals QB hopes to play at AT&T Stadium, where he's 8-0.

title: Why is Mike McDaniel still in Miami? Answering key questions about Dolphins' shakeup
content: Answering the key questions following the Dolphins' decision to part ways with Chris Grier and keep Mike McDaniel.

title: Draft risers, questions and notes: Sizing up LaNorris Sellers' great traits vs. lack of production
content: Is Sellers still a first-rounder? How does Carnell Tate rate against recent OSU receivers? We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 10.

title: Saturday Night's Main Event takeaways: Has Jey Uso's time to claim the World Heavyweight title passed?
content: CM Punk and Jade Cargill are now WWE champions. Andreas Hale and Arda Ocal recap the four title matches on WWE Saturday Night's Main Event.

title: üé† Resetting the college football coaching carousel
content: Coaching changes are happening fast. With a month left in the season, here are six things to monitor.

title: üèà Governor: LSU AD won't select football coach
content: Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry told reporters Wednesday that LSU athletic director Scott Woodward won't be involved in selecting the Tigers' new football coach in the wake of Brian Kelly's firing.

title: üèÄ Jordan: Load management never should happen
content: Michael Jordan didn't hold back on load management in the NBA, saying on NBC: "It shouldn't be needed, first and foremost."

title: ‚öæ Chapman: I'd rather retire than rejoin Yankees
content: Aroldis Chapman ripped the Yankees in a podcast, saying he would "retire on the spot" before playing for them ever again.

title: üëë The legend of Georgia Tech QB Haynes King
content: Stories about how the quarterback became one of the quirkiest, toughest and most insatiable players in college football.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Pats trade White to 49ers, Dugger to Steelers
content: The Patriots traded away two former defensive starters Tuesday night, sending defensive end Keion White to the 49ers and safety Kyle Dugger to the Steelers, sources told ESPN.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye loan deal for Real Madrid's Endrick
content: Real Madrid's Endrick is a loan target for Premier League rivals Manchester United and Aston Villa. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: At the stroke of midnight, India awake as World Champions!
content: Outclassing South Africa by 52 runs in the final of the 2025 Women‚Äôs ODI World Cup at the DY Patil Stadium on Sunday night, with 45,000 fans cheering them, India finally put an end to their long wait for an elusive World Cup crown. A billion hearts can now celebrate the Women in Blue‚Äôs memorable, historic, game-changing triumph for women‚Äôs cricket in India for a long time to come ‚Äî courtesy of a player who wasn‚Äôt even in the reserves!

title: Tears, hugs, emotions take over! IND Women celebrate first ODI World Cup title - watch
content: Harmanpreet Kaur's India clinched their maiden ICC Women's World Cup title, defeating South Africa by 52 runs. Shafali Verma's stellar performance with bat and ball was pivotal in ending India's long wait for the coveted trophy, marking a historic triumph after previous final heartbreaks. They defeated South Africa in the summit clash at the DY Patil Stadium.

title: ‚ÄòSpectacular win‚Äô: PM Modi congratulates Indian women‚Äôs team for ODI World Cup win
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the Indian women's cricket team on their spectacular win in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 final. He lauded their great skill, confidence, exceptional teamwork, and tenacity, calling it a historic triumph that will inspire future generations of athletes.

title: Rs 39 crore! India women‚Äôs cricket team set to pocket record prize money after World Cup win
content: Team India has secured a record-breaking USD 4.48 million prize money after winning the Women's World Cup 2025 final against South Africa. This historic victory marks a significant financial uplift for women's cricket, with the ICC significantly increasing the tournament's prize pool. The BCCI is also reportedly considering matching the men's team's T20 World Cup prize money.

title: Return of the G-2 Duopoly: US, China embrace leaves India out in cold
content: US President Donald Trump has declared China a functional equal, signaling a new G-2 duopoly that sidelines other global powers. This marks a significant policy shift, moving away from viewing China as an existential threat. The move suggests a strategic realignment prioritizing US-China cooperation for global stability and success.

title: Musk, Rogan talk about alien object aiming at Earth that Harvard scientist say 'isn't natural'
content: Unauthorized SpaceX Starshield transmissions coincide with intense scrutiny of Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar object exhibiting unusual nickel composition and trajectory. Discussions on The Joe Rogan Experience podcast with Elon Musk touched upon potential alien probes and the Tunguska Event, fueling speculation about extraterrestrial origins.

title: List of Women‚Äôs World Cup winners: Full list of champions over the years
content: India has won their maiden Women's ODI World Cup title, defeating South Africa in a thrilling final. This historic victory marks India's first World Cup triumph after previous runner-up finishes. The tournament, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka, witnessed record crowds and exceptional cricketing performances throughout, up until the summit clash in Navi Mumbai.

title: Einstein‚Äôs ‚Äòalmost-sleep‚Äô secret: 5 ways the in-between state can lift grades
content: Einstein‚Äôs quiet ritual of drifting between wakefulness and sleep revealed a hidden truth about learning: creativity thrives in the in-between. Neuroscience now calls this the hypnagogic state‚Äîa fleeting moment when logic loosens and imagination ignites. Studies show this phase heightens insight, strengthens memory, and sharpens focus, making it a powerful tool for modern learners.

title: Asset seizure before conviction of goons a necessity: UP in Supreme Court
content: The Uttar Pradesh government defended its anti-gangster law, telling the Supreme Court that attaching properties before conviction is crucial to prevent accused individuals from alienating ill-gotten assets. The state argued the law is necessary to combat escalating gangsterism, citing similar provisions in other central and state acts.

title: Consumed by AI: Sam Altman admits OpenAI is consuming him; says it's ‚Äòa little sad‚Äô
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman expressed envy for today's young entrepreneurs, particularly those skipping college to innovate. He noted that AI advancements allow small teams to build sophisticated products rapidly, a stark contrast to his early career. Altman also shared that OpenAI consumes his mental space, preventing him from pursuing new startup ideas.

title: ‚ÄòLove you girls‚Äô: Kohli, Anushka share emotional msg; congratulate World Cup champion India
content: India has finally clinched its maiden ICC Women's World Cup title, defeating South Africa by 52 runs. Stellar performances from Shafali Verma (87) and Deepti Sharma (58 runs, 5 wickets) powered the team to a historic victory. Afterwards, Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma shared emotional messages of support and congratulations to the victors.

title: Mumbai's $800,000 shortcut: Wealthy Indians buying their way past H-1B hurdles
content: Facing decades-long waits for employment-based Green Cards, many Indians are opting for the EB-5 investment program. This route, requiring significant capital, offers a faster path to US residency, especially for H-1B visa holders and high-net-worth families securing their children's future. Despite recent discussions of a 'Gold Card' alternative, the EB-5 program, bolstered by recent reforms, continues to see strong demand.

title: Two desi lads in Silicon Valley become youngest self-made billionaires at 22
content: Three 22-year-old friends, including Indian-Americans Adarsh Hiremath and Surya Midha, have become the world's youngest self-made billionaires. Their AI recruiting platform, Mercor, secured $350 million in funding, valuing the company at $10 billion.  This Silicon Valley startup, born from high school debate skills, now serves major AI labs and tech giants.

title: Corporate duty call: Seattle Mayor tells Amazon, Microsoft to reinvest; says they have obligation
content: Mayor Bruce Harrell urged Seattle's tech giants like Microsoft and Amazon to reinvest in the community, citing their substantial profits and a "moral obligation." This call highlights the city's challenge of balancing tech's economic benefits with its impacts on housing and transportation, as Harrell seeks re-election against a progressive challenger.

title: Rajasthan: 15 pilgrims killed, 2 injured as tourist bus collides with trailer in Phalodi
content: Tragedy struck in Rajasthan's Phalodi on Sunday as a tourist bus returning from Bikaner collided with a parked trailer, claiming the lives of fifteen pilgrims. Two individuals sustained serious injuries and are receiving urgent medical attention, with authorities establishing a green corridor for their swift transfer. The administration is prioritising the care of the injured.

title: Bahubali vs Bahubali: How killing in Bihar's Bhumihar belt has turned poll into prestige battle
content: The murder of a campaigner in Mokama has escalated a local assembly fight into a high-stakes battle between two powerful Bhumihar strongmen, Anant Singh and Surajbhan Singh. This incident has reignited caste loyalties and questions of law and order, turning the election into a prestige fight reflecting Bihar's enduring 'bahubali' politics.

title: Bhojpuri beats: Singers who rock the Bihar polls
content: Bhojpuri folk songs are a significant force in Bihar's election fervor, with both NDA and Mahagathbandhan leveraging catchy tunes to attract voters. Prominent singers and actors like Manoj Tiwari, Pawan Singh, Dinesh Lal Yadav, and Ravi Kishan are amplifying campaign messages, while Khesari Lal Yadav leads the Mahagathbandhan's musical outreach.

title: Taylor Swift fears for her safety as Travis Kelce focuses on new season
content: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about her security and privacy, wanting to avoid excessive media attention during Kansas City Chiefs games. While not asking for broadcasts to stop, she desires to maintain a lower profile. Meanwhile, Travis Kelce praised Swift's latest album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on his podcast, highlighting its success.

title: Shane Bieber‚Äôs wife reacts to Alejandro Kirk‚Äôs wife‚Äôs viral World Series post
content: Blue Jays catcher Alejandro Kirk's stellar World Series performance is matched by the heartwarming social media buzz surrounding his wife, Sofia Castaneda. A simple emoji comment from Shane Bieber's wife, Kara, on Sofia's post celebrating Kirk's success ignited a viral moment, highlighting the strong camaraderie among the team's families and captivating fans.

title: Stefon Diggs‚Äô alleged K‚Äôyanna Barber affair escalates as Cardi B expects baby
content: Rapper Cardi B is reportedly expecting twins with NFL player Stefon Diggs, but the couple faces controversy. Diggs is also accused of fathering twins with another woman, K‚Äôyanna Barber, a situation neither party has publicly addressed. This alleged infidelity has caused fan uproar as Cardi B continues to share her pregnancy publicly.

title: Hamstring issue puts Donovan Mitchell‚Äôs availability vs Hawks in doubt
content: Donovan Mitchell's left hamstring injury has him questionable for the Cavaliers' crucial November 2, 2025, matchup against the Atlanta Hawks.  The team, already battling other injuries, faces offensive uncertainty without their leading scorer.  His availability is a game-time decision that will significantly impact Cleveland's performance and their aim to avoid falling further in the standings.

title: Another big win for Isro's 'Bahubali': India places its heaviest satellite in orbit
content: ISRO successfully launched CMS-03, its heaviest communication satellite, using the LVM3-M5 rocket from Sriharikota. The mission marked the fifth operational flight for the LVM3 vehicle, placing the 4410-kg satellite into a Geo-synchronous Transfer Orbit. This multi-band satellite will provide crucial communication services over oceanic regions and the Indian landmass for both civil and strategic purposes.

title: 'God sent me here': Shafali Verma's words come true; top scores for IND in final
content: Shafali Verma made a dramatic return to the Indian squad for the 2025 World Cup semis and final after an injury to Pratika Rawal. She seized the opportunity, scoring a career-best 87 off 78 balls against South Africa. Her explosive innings, alongside Smriti Mandhana, set a strong foundation for India's innings in the final, marking a dream comeback.

title: India‚Äôs tech pay plunges: US engineers strike gold; AI boom widens the gap
content: The University of Pennsylvania is probing a fake and offensive email that falsely appeared to come from its Graduate School of Education. The message, sent Friday with the subject ‚ÄúWe got hacked,‚Äù contained racial slurs and attacked Penn‚Äôs integrity. The university confirmed the email was fraudulent, denied any hacking, and launched a cybersecurity investigation.

title: Holy aim? Shimla civic body ad shows Lord Rama‚Äôs arrow pointed at garbage; sparks outrage
content: Shimla police have filed a case following a complaint about a banner near the Himachal Pradesh Secretariat. The banner showed Lord Rama aiming an arrow at a garbage heap. An advocate alleged the display offended Hindu beliefs. Police are investigating the incident under relevant laws. The complaint also raised concerns about similar banners elsewhere in the city.

title: IND vs SA | Rohit Sharma joins Nita Ambani & Sachin to cheer on hosts; fans go berserk
content: Navi Mumbai's DY Stadium buzzed with excitement for the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 final. Celebrities like Sachin Tendulkar and Rohit Sharma graced the stands, drawing cheers. Fans eagerly followed India's strong batting performance, with openers Shafali Verma and Smriti Mandhana setting a solid foundation. The atmosphere was electric as India aimed for a historic victory.

title: McSwadeshi? McDonald's serves millet bun burger; Centre calls it 'vindication'
content: McDonald's has launched a millet bun burger in India, a move hailed by the government as a "vindication" of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's "Millet movement." The burger utilizes indigenous technology developed by a Mysore-based institute, showcasing Indian innovation in traditional nutrition and global food trends.

title: Nigeria hits back at Trump: Prez Tinubu rejects claims of attacks on Christians
content: Nigeria has rejected claims of religious intolerance following a directive from former US President Donald Trump to prepare for potential military intervention over attacks on Christians. President Bola Ahmed Tinubu stated that the characterization does not reflect Nigeria's reality, emphasizing constitutional guarantees for freedom of belief for all citizens.

title: Can Curtis Sliwa upset the New York applecart?
content: Sliwa, 69, isn‚Äôt new to the rodeo. He founded the Guardian Angels in 1979 ‚Äî a street-patrol crew born in the crime-ravaged Bronx ‚Äî and spun it into a decades-long persona as a radio firebrand, neighbourhood vigilante, and walking emblem of New York grit. He stood for mayor in 2021 and lost heavily to Eric Adams, but never really left the trail. Now he‚Äôs back ‚Äî still a Republican, still loud, still proudly fringe ‚Äî and if the polls are right, still stuck in third place.

title: Ashwin's post backfires: Cricketer hails Shafali; batter out for 87 minutes later!
content: Shafali Verma narrowly missed a World Cup final century, scoring a brilliant 87 off 78 balls against South Africa. Her dismissal in the 28th over, after a lofted shot was caught, ended a stunning innings from the batter. Veteran spinner R. Ashwin's tweet minutes before the wicket about her potential hundred led to humorous fan accusations of a 'jinx'.

title: 'Held Cong at gunpoint': PM Modi on how Tejashwi became oppn's Bihar CM face; takes shot at MGB
content: Prime Minister Modi intensified his criticism of the INDIA bloc in Bihar, alleging the RJD forced the Congress to name Tejashwi Yadav as CM candidate, comparing it to a gun to the head. He contrasted the NDA's unity and development focus with the opposition's alleged "jungle raj" and corruption, promising farmer support.

title: Women‚Äôs World Cup: Gambhir, Bumrah caught watching the final inside dressing room
content: While India's men's T20I team battled in Hobart, the entire dressing room was captivated by Harmanpreet Kaur's India in the Women's World Cup final. Shafali Verma's brilliant 87 guided India to 172 for three after 30 overs, setting up a historic chase for their maiden World Cup title against South Africa.

title: 'Op Sindoor gave Pak, Cong sleepless nights': PM Modi's scathing attack in Bihar; targets Gandhis
content: Prime Minister Modi highlighted India's retaliatory Operation Sindoor in Bihar, stating it caused sleepless nights for the Congress' "first family." He also asserted that Congress reluctantly accepted Tejashwi Yadav as the Mahagathbandhan's CM face under RJD pressure, predicting a historic defeat for "jungle raj" proponents and a sweeping NDA victory.

title: Chargers LB Daiyan Henley‚Äôs brother Jabari killed in targeted shooting
content: Los Angeles Chargers linebacker Daiyan Henley is grappling with the tragic loss of his older brother, Jabari, who was fatally shot on October 31, 2025. The 34-year-old's death, believed to be linked to a personal dispute, has devastated the family. Despite immense grief, Daiyan chose to play, dedicating the game to his brother's memory.

title: Highest-ever! Mandhana shatters WC record; falls whisker short of another milestone
content: Smriti Mandhana has become India Women's highest run-getter in a single ODI World Cup edition, surpassing Mithali Raj's 2017 record. Her consistent performance throughout the tournament, including a strong opening partnership in the final, highlighted her batting prowess. Mandhana narrowly missed reaching 1,000 World Cup runs, a feat achieved by only two other Indian batters.

title: Bihar polls: 20 yrs on, violence returns to Mokama as baahubalis clash for supremacy
content: A political murder in Bihar's Mokama has reignited fears of election violence after a local strongman, Dularchand Yadav, was killed during a poll campaign clash. His family blames JDU candidate Anant Singh, while Singh points fingers at rival Surajbhan Singh, whose wife is also contesting. The incident highlights deep-rooted caste rivalries and political complexities in the constituency.

title: 3rd T20I: Arshdeep, Sundar star; India beat Australia to square series 1-1
content: India leveled the T20I series against Australia with a five-wicket victory in Hobart, successfully chasing 187. Washington Sundar's unbeaten 49 off 23 balls was pivotal, while Arshdeep Singh's early wickets earned him Player of the Match. Tim David's 74 had earlier propelled Australia to 186.

title: 2025 layoffs aren‚Äôt routine: AI rewires workflows; reskilling misses the point
content: The 2025 layoff wave reflects structural shifts, not mere cost-cutting. Companies, particularly in tech, are redirecting capital from headcount to AI infrastructure, automating tasks, and redesigning workflows. Pandemic-era hiring created surplus roles now being flattened. Reskilling alone won‚Äôt protect employees; differentiation comes from proving measurable impact. Students and professionals must focus on solving real problems, building domain-specific skill stacks, and demonstrating tangible improvements, as employers prioritise judgment and workflow integration over certificates or interchangeable skills.

title: 'Got a panic attack': Rahul mocks PM at Bihar rally; claims Modi 'scared of Trump'
content: Rahul Gandhi accused Prime Minister Modi of being fearful of Donald Trump and controlled by industrialists Ambani and Adani. He claimed Modi panicked during a conflict with Pakistan due to Trump's intervention. Gandhi also criticized government policies like demonetization and GST for harming small businesses and pledged the INDIA bloc would prioritize Bihar's development and education.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls Kobe‚Äôs heartbreaking moment with daughter Gianna
content: Vanessa Bryant is releasing a photo book, 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever,' featuring cherished memories of Kobe and Gianna Bryant. She shared a touching moment from the 2009 NBA Finals, where Kobe cradled a young Gigi, his focus solely on his daughter's pride. The book aims to preserve these heartfelt moments for the world to remember.

title: Pankaj Tripathi‚Äôs mother passes away at 89; actor was by her side; urges privacy
content: The actor's mother, who was unwell for some time, left for her heavenly abode at the family's hometown in Belsand, Gopalganj, in Bihar on Friday, October 31.

title: PAK vs SA - 'In the next four or five years‚Ä¶': Salman Agha drops bombshell on Babar Azam
content: Babar Azam's crucial half-century guided Pakistan to a series-clinching four-wicket victory over South Africa in the T20I decider. His composed 68 off 47 balls, supported by captain Salman Ali Agha's 33, helped Pakistan successfully chase 140. Pakistan's bowlers also played a key role, keeping South Africa under par.

title: Women's World Cup final: What changes did Harmanpreet Kaur make to India's Playing XI?
content: South Africa won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the ICC Women's ODI World Cup final. Heavy rain delayed the start, but no overs were lost. Both captains expressed confidence in their teams' abilities to perform under the overcast conditions and on a pitch expected to settle.

title: Another Indian woman caught shoplifting in US; cries 'sorry' - video goes viral
content: A viral video shows an Indian woman crying and pleading with US officers, claiming she "forgot to pay" for items. The incident, which the TOI could not independently verify, echoes a previous case where an Indian tourist was arrested for shoplifting nearly $1,000 worth of goods. US authorities warn that such offenses can lead to visa revocation and future ineligibility.

title: Sneako calls out Erika Kirk over viral JD Vance hug and Charlie Kirk remark
content: A viral video shows Erika Kirk, widow of Charlie Kirk, hugging Vice President JD Vance at a Turning Point USA event. Kirk's speech comparing Vance to her late husband sparked debate, with a subsequent hug drawing widespread online commentary. Streamer Sneako's mocking remarks added to the controversy, making the incident a major political talking point.

title: Catch of the day! Rahul takes a plunge, goes fishing in Begusarai pond - watch
content: Rahul Gandhi participated in a traditional fish-catching event in Begusarai as part of his Bihar election campaign. He also criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi, accusing him of diverting youth's attention from unemployment and being controlled by Ambani and Adani.

title: Hamas Returns Remains of 3 Hostages, Israel Confirms
content: The Israeli military said on Sunday the Red Cross had taken possession of the remains of three hostages from Gaza as part of the ongoing ceasefire agreement.

title: Drunk Passenger Pushes Woman Out Of Moving Train In Kerala
content: A woman was critically injured after a drunk passenger pushed her out of a moving train near Varkala here on Sunday, police said.

title: 'Divine Experience': PM Modi Offers Prayers At Patna Sahib Gurdwara
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi offered prayers at the Patna Sahib gurdwara here on Sunday evening and termed it as a "divine experience."

title: Shots Fired, Vehicles Damaged: Children's Fight Leads To Clash In Nashik
content: A clash between two groups in Malegaon town in Nashik district resulted in one person firing on another, who managed to avoid getting hit, as well as damage to vehicles parked nearby, a police official said on Sunday.

title: 'Not A Terror Incident': British National Arrested For UK Train Stabbing
content: Ten people were injured following a mass stabbing on a London-bound train on Saturday evening, with the police arresting two suspects. Of the injured, nine have "life-threatening injuries."

title: Air Quality Worsens In Delhi As Weak Winds Trap Pollutants
content: Delhi's air quality worsened on Sunday as weak winds trapped pollutants, raising the overall AQI to 366 in the "very poor" category with three monitoring stations recording "severe" air above 400, Centre Pollution Control Board data showed.

title: Toddler Falls Into Bucket Of Hot Water In UP, Dies
content: A one-and-a-half-year-old boy died after accidentally falling into a bucket of boiling water here, police said on Sunday.

title: US Threatens New Tariffs If China Blocks Rare Earth Exports
content: US President Donald Trump's administration is prepared to raise tariffs on China if Beijing continues blocking rare earth exports, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent warned Sunday.

title: Canadian PM's "Progress" With India Comment Amid Tariff Tensions With US
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney has referred to the "progress" his country has made with India as he stressed that Canada is building partnerships abroad amid tariff pressures with the US.

title: Tehran's Main Source Of Drinking Water To Run Dry In 2 Weeks: Official
content: Tehran's main source of drinking water is at risk of running dry within two weeks, state media warned on Sunday, owing to a historic drought.

title: We Plan To Launch 7 Missions By March 2026: ISRO Chief
content: ISRO has set a target to launch seven missions, including its ambitious first uncrewed mission under the Gangayaan programme, before the end of March 2026, Chairman V Narayanan said on Sunday.

title: India's Exports To US Dip 37.5% During May-Sept: Think Tank
content: India's exports to the US have dipped 37.5 per cent during May-September 2025 from $8.8 billion in May to $5.5 billion in September, think tank GTRI said on Sunday.

title: This Professor Leads An OpenAI Panel With Power To Halt Unsafe AI Releases
content: Zico Kolter leads a 4-person panel at OpenAI that has the authority to halt the ChatGPT maker's release of new AI systems if it finds them unsafe.

title: 17 Quacks Arrested In 90 Days: How An Assam District Became Fake Doctors Hub
content: Assam Police in Cachar district have intensified their ongoing campaign against medical fraud, arresting two more individuals suspected of practising as fake doctors in the last two days.

title: Cases Filed Against My Family Members To 'Coerce' Me: Ex-CJI NV Ramana
content: Former Chief Justice of India NV Ramana has said that cases were filed against his family members to "coerce" him.

title: Top Woman Maoist With Rs 14-Lakh Bounty Surrenders In Madhya Pradesh
content: A woman Maoist carrying a reward of Rs 14 lakh on her head surrendered in Balaghat in Madhya Pradesh, a police official said on Sunday.

title: 15 Killed, 3 Injured After Bus Rams Parked Trailer In Rajasthan
content: At least 15 people were killed and three injured after a tempo traveller bus rammed a parked trailer in Rajasthan, police said.

title: After Siddaramaiah, DK Shivakumar Should Become Chief Minister: Karnataka Minister
content: Karnataka Minister BZ Zameer Ahmed Khan on Sunday said, Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has the desire to become the chief minister, and his wish is that he takes over after Siddaramaiah completes his five-year term in 2028.

title: Couple With Children Among Those Charged In Louvre Heist
content: Small-time criminals are believed to be behind the spectacular jewel heist at the Louvre, the top Paris prosecutor said Sunday, adding that two of the suspects are a couple with children.

title: World Series champs -- again! Game 7 win cements Dodgers' dynasty
content: will Smith hits the go-ahead home run in extras as the Dodgers win their second straight world Series . the franchise closed out the Toronto Blue Jays with a 5-4 win in extra innings in Game 7 on Saturday . it was easy to think about the fourth lefty on the franchise's bullpen depth chart, a 37-year-old .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: The comprehensive guide to the women's hoops season, including preseason picks
content: the road to Phoenix and the women's final four starts Monday, when the 2025-26 season opens . some new names will be vying for national player of the year . the Huskies have moved on to the WNBA, and 'juJu Watkins' will sit out this season .

title: Week 10 truths: Miami is a mess, Ohio State looks like a sure thing
content: at points in history, the wisest among us believed, with some degree of certainty, that the earth was flat, that sea dragons consumed ships filled with gold, that Texas was back . in time, most of us who aren't Kyrie Irving have come to understand the folly of such ideas . they simply lacked information, but as we learn more, we refine our notions of how the world works .

title: Matchups for the playoff and beyond: Predicting every CFB postseason game
content: the biggest shockwaves came in the ACC, where Georgia Tech suffered its first loss of the season . if the Cavaliers can hold on, they would be a most unlikely participant in the college football Playoff . the five highest-ranked conference champions, plus the next seven high-ranked teams, will make the field .

title: Cardi B in Foxborough: Kraft's suite, Diggs' touchdown and a trademark celebration
content: cardi B spends time with her boyfriend to support her boyfriend Stefon Diggs . the couple previously announced they are expecting a child together . a videoboard at Gillette Stadium showed Cardi B cheering after a touchdown .

title: Where Auburn ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: the 2025-26 coaching cycle wasn't expected to be calm, like its predecessor . but few forecast such a robust line of storms rolling through the sport in the first half of the season . all four power conferences have had a firing .

title: üèà CFP top 12: Predicting what committee will do
content: defending national champion Ohio State should start the first college football playoff rankings on Tuesday . there could be some debate over the top spot when the 12 members of this year's group vote on teams for their first official top 25 ranking of the season . the bigger discussion will likely revolve around one-loss Alabama and undefeated Texas A&M for the no. 3 and no. 4 spots .

title: Kraft, Golden injured in Packers' loss to Panthers
content: rookie wideout ruled out of game against the Carolina Panthers after knee injury . first-round pick Matthew Golden also out after shoulder injury in third quarter . the Packers went on to win 16-13 on a last-second field goal .

title: AP Week 10 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: a wild week in the ACC with the two highest-ranked teams in the conference losing to unranked opponents . the AP top 25 is based on stats courtesy of ESPN Research . Ohio State has won nine straight games against Penn Staples .

title: Every MLB team's odds to win the 2026 World Series: Dodgers open as favorites
content: The confetti has fallen on the 2025 MLB season, as the  Los Angeles Dodgers  completed a Game 7 comeback for the ages and claimed their second straight World Series championship, this time over the American League champion  Toronto Blue Jays . The star-studded Dodgers -- featuring  Shohei Ohtani  and  Mookie Betts  -- will return as the favorites to win the 2026 World Series, followed by the  New York Yankees ,  Houston Astros  and  Philadelphia Phillies . The Blue Jays open at 20-1, tied with the  Chicago Cubs  for 11th. The  Seattle Mariners , the AL runners-up, open at 14-1, while the  Milwaukee Brewers , who had the league's best record in 2025, open at 18-1. At the other end of the spectrum, the  Chicago White Sox  and  Colorado Rockies  open at 500-1. Odds as of publish time. For more, visit  ESPN BET Sportsbook.   By ESPN BET

title: TMC MLA Jyotipriyo Mallick attacked by stranger; accused arrested
content: The official said the accused, aged around 30 years, had trailed Mr. Mallick, who entered his residence around 9 p.m. The youth suddenly pounced on the former Minister and punched him in his lower abdomen

title: Coastal promenade in Chellanam‚ÄìPuthenthode corridor turns a hit
content: Built at a cost of around ‚Çπ344 crore and touted as Kerala‚Äôs longest, the seawall-cum-walkway is seeing growing demand for benches and lights to draw more visitors

title: CPI(ML) launches women-centric campaign in Bihar
content: It will be held in 20 constituencies where the CPI(ML) aims to foreground issues affecting women, including gender-based violence, microfinance debt, and the exploitation of scheme workers such as ASHAs and Jeevika workers

title: Coast Guard evacuates ailing seafarer
content: The Ukrainian national had been suffering from acute periumbilical pain for two days aboard the Malta-flagged vessel MT Minerva Vera

title: Cochin Port‚Äôs ‚Çπ300-cr. project to transform Willingdon Island into a major tourist destination
content: It is part of the CPA‚Äôs mission to develop a mega cruise terminal and related infrastructure, realising the port‚Äôs potential as a preferred cruise ship destination

title: Revival of Kochi Metropolitan Transport Authority in cold storage
content: While considering a PIL, a Bench comprising Chief Justice Nitin Jamdar and Justice Basant Balaji observed that KMTA has the potential to integrate multiple transport modes, enhance last-mile connectivity, rationalise fares, and frame a parking policy

title: 737 cases booked in crackdown on erring private bus operators
content: The drive, being carried out with the support of the police, was launched on October 25. On the first day, 63 cases were registered, followed by 28 on the second and 63 on the third

title: In Bihar‚Äôs Khagaria, people want to vote for development
content: Khagaria is surrounded by seven rivers; people point out that no leader has resolved the basic issue of flooding, which has made their life difficult; it also has high rates of migration

title: PMK stays away from multi-party meet on SIR of electoral rolls despite invite to Ramadoss
content: Salem West MLA R. Arul says he did not attend the meeting so as to not seem as though the party founder is allying with the DMK

title: EC must ensure strict enforcement of MCC in Bihar: D. Raja
content: The CPI chief‚Äôs statements come in the wake of the murder of Dularchand Yadav, who was a supporter of Jan Suraaj candidate Piyush Priyadarshi, in Mokama

title: Foreign diplomats visiting poll-bound Bihar as part of ‚ÄòKnow BJP‚Äô initiative
content: The visit is being conducted under the ‚ÄúKnow BJP‚Äù initiative launched by BJP National President J.P. Nadda

title: Biography of M.S. Swaminathan released in Chennai
content: Titled The Man Who Fed India and authored by Priyambada Jayakumar, the book traces the scientist‚Äôs childhood to his eventual association with Nobel laureate Norman Borlaug, which ultimately led to the Green Revolution

title: WB BJP alleges BLOs appointed for SIR have Trinamool links
content: Party writes to Chief Electoral Officer, claims politically affiliated appointments ahead of elections

title: Hit by train, tusker dies in Odisha
content: The incident occurred around 11.50 p.m. on Saturday (November 1, 2025) when the Shalimaar-Baripada Express train crossed the Jugal railway station

title: Maharashtra doctors stage protests demanding speedy probe into Phaltan suicide
content: The 28-year-old medical officer posted at the Phaltan Sub-District Hospital in Satara, who hailed from Beed district, was found dead in a hotel room on October 22, leaving a note naming a police official and two others for harassment¬†¬†

title: Push for Ramsar site tag for wetlands in Assam wildlife sanctuary
content: The Rowmari-Donduwa wetland complex in the Kaziranga-Orang landscape has been recording more birds than the only two Ramsar Sites in the northeast ‚Äì Assam‚Äôs Deepor Beel and Manipur‚Äôs Loktak Lake

title: Woman Maoist surrenders in Madhya Pradesh‚Äôs Balaghat, first since State‚Äôs new rehabilitation policy
content: Sunita, from Chhattisgarh, was a bodyguard to a senior Maoist leader and carried a reward of ‚Çπ14 lakh on her head; she led the police to her forest hideout to recover arms and ammunition

title: Trinamool links migrant worker‚Äôs death to SIR; Opposition accuses party of stoking panic
content: Trinamool alleges Special Intensive Revision drove fear and despair; BJP, Congress and CPI(M) call the charge politicisation

title: SIR is a trick to drop genuine voters from the rolls, says Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Stalin
content: The exercise, which deprived people of their voting rights in Bihar, is being introduced in States including¬†Tamil Nadu. It is the need of the hour to express objections to it, he says at a multi-party meeting held in Chennai

title: Barring an MP, Leh in Ladakh has no elected representatives since October 31
content: The five-year term of the hill council came to an end on October 31 and fresh elections may be held only after talks between civil society groups and Ministry of Home Affairs take a decisive turn

title: Rajasthan bus accident: At least 15 killed as tempo traveller rams truck in Rajasthan
content: All the deceased were residents of Sursagar in Jodhpur, who were returning after visiting a temple in Bikaner district‚Äôs Kolayat; PM Modi announces ex-gratia of ‚Çπ2 lakh to the families of those dead and ‚Çπ50,000 to the injured

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 9
content: the playbook for week 9 kicks off with the Ravens at the Dolphins . the column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and, of course, easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS .

title: Research unearths Thiruvananthapuram Observatory‚Äôs 162-year chronicle of magnetic equator
content: Research paper chronicles the observatory‚Äôs contributions to mapping the magnetic equator in India and tracking its gradual southward migration toward Sri Lanka

title: Ending household poverty to be key to LDF‚Äôs campaign for local body polls
content: LDF convener says ruling coalition has finalised its seat sharing and set its local body electioneering in motion

title: From PILs to name-calling: How tunnel road project became a political battlefield
content: Though the tunnel road plan was unveiled over a year ago, the BJP staged its first full-fledged protest only on Sunday, under the slogan ‚ÄòSave Lalbagh, Protect Bengaluru‚Äô

title: Karnataka planning to set up permanent water commission on the lines of Central Water Commission
content: The proposed commission that comprises experts will recommend measures to the State government on water security and on matters of water disputes

title: A year since his death, uncertainty surrounds M.M. Lawrence‚Äôs body
content: After his death, the body was handed over to Government Medical College, Ernakulam, for medical studies. But his daughters challenged the decision, seeking burial under Christian rites

title: PM Modi to inaugurate Emerging Science and Technology Innovation Conclave
content: Prime Minister to launch ‚Çπ1 lakh crore fund to boost private sector-led research and development ecosystem

title: Kerala Police launch mobile app to keep workers in Sabarimala under surveillance
content: App enables police to trace the identity of every worker using their name, Aadhaar number, or phone number. Over 5,200 workers have been added to the database. Earlier, lack of data used to make it difficult for the police to trace individuals with criminal backgrounds.

title: Tripura police deny permission for Tipra Motha-linked rally in Agartala
content: Authorities cite safety and crowd management concerns as reason for refusal; recent violence in several districts reviewed before decision

title: LDF to seek speedy legal steps for staying SIR in crucial election year in Kerala
content: LDF convener says EC has shown political bias by disregarding a unanimous resolution passed by the Kerala Assembly against SIR, while giving reprieve to Maharashtra and Assam

title: Ex same-sex couple‚Äôs legal battle tests India‚Äôs gender and marriage law
content: A gender dysphoric petitioner seeks to quash FIRs filed by her estranged female partner, raising questions over whether offences premised on ‚Äòhusband-wife‚Äô roles can apply to same-sex couples

title: Kerala to actively explore potential of seaweed cultivation
content: State Fisheries department has announced plans to promote seaweed aquaculture and export-oriented industries

title: Mahayuti will win Maharashtra local polls due to good governance, relief measures: Shinde
content: The Deputy CM cites ‚Çπ32,000-crore relief package for farmers, ‚Çπ120-crore pollution plan as evidence of the ruling alliance focus on development; comes a day after united Opposition protest on voter‚Äôs list irregularities

title: Mohanlal‚Äôs possession of ivory artefacts may result in another wildlife crime case
content: Case booked against actor was only for possession of elephant tusks. Forest dept. can append the case of artefacts to the ivory if it came into his possession in a single transaction. The High Court recently struck down the ownership certificates issued to both tusks and artefacts

title: Congress cadre ransack ‚ÄòBRS office‚Äô in Manuguru; prohibitory orders issued
content: The building has been a bone of contention as it was used as the BRS office after Congress MLA Rega Kantha Rao defected to BRS in 2019

title: Seven wild elephants dead in 10 years
content: Ishwar Khandre, Forest Minister said the incident had come to his notice and that he had asked senior officers to inquire into it and submit a report

title: Grief-stricken families perform last rites of nine persons who died in temple stampede in Srikakulam district
content: Union Minister Rammohan Naidu, Agriculture Minister Atchannaidu console bereaved family members and hand them over ‚Çπ15 lakh ex gratia; Endowments Minister Ramanarayana Reddy says a committee will look into reasons for stampede
